src:
Agnes Ravatn hadde kronisk dårlig samvittighet for timene hun sløste bort på jobb. Så tok hun grep.
07 Nov 2019, 07:45 by Kathrine Humberset
– Flere ønsker å lære å skille mellom jobb og fritid, sier arbeids- og organisasjonspsykolog Krister Halck.
Året er 2011. På et kontor sitter journalist Agnes Ravatn. Arbeidsdagen er over for flere timer siden, men hun er langt fra ferdig med dagens oppgaver. Deadline nærmer seg, og hun vet at det blir skippertak denne gangen også.
text:
Agnes Ravatn had a chronic conscience for the hours she wasted at work. Then she took hold.
07 Nov 2019, 07:45 by Kathrine Humberset
- More people want to learn how to distinguish between work and leisure, says work and organizational psychologist Krister Halck.
The year is 2011. In an office is journalist Agnes Ravatn. The working day is over several hours ago, but she is far from finished with the day's tasks. Deadline is approaching, and she knows there will be skipper roofs this time as well.
